title: Traditional, Complementary and Integrative Medicine
description: Traditional medicine has a long history. It is the sum total of the knowledge, skill, and practices based on the theories, beliefs, and experiences indigenous to different cultures, whether explicable or not, used in the maintenance of health as well as in the prevention, diagnosis, improvement or treatment of physical and mental illness.
cleaned_text: As of 2015, there were 3,966 Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) hospitals and 45,528 TCM clinics across China In Korea, a survey on utilization of traditional medicine conducted by Ministry of Health and Welfare in 2014 showed that 27.1% of respondents used outpatient traditional medicine services A national survey on use of complementary medicine in Australia in 2005 suggested that 68.9% of participants used at least one of the 17 forms of complementary medicine and 44.1% visited a complementary medicine practitioner in the 12-month period.
